intro: Huernia saudi-arabica, commonly known as the Saudi moon cactus, is a succulent native to arid regions of Saudi Arabia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its swollen, fleshy stems that store water. The plant typically has a short, thick stem with a single or few flowers that bloom in shades of yellow or orange. Its leaves are usually reduced to small, spiny structures, and it thrives in full sun with minimal water. Huernia saudi-arabica is well adapted to hot, dry climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
